name: places/ChIJfx3HmItZwokR7ssq4aeNH6Y
formattedAddress: 77 Essex St, New York, NY 10002, USA
adrFormatAddress: 77 Essex St, New York, NY 10002, USA

originalText.text:
Went here for a friend's birthday and honestly I'm so dissapointed I didnt hear about this place sooner.
Bowling in NYC that is affordable has amazing music and really chill. It's the perfect place to chill out with friends while doing an activity.
The staff is really helpful and welcoming. I didnt have the food but I wouldnt go here for anything other than light bites. The drinks were reasonably priced. We did have a few malfunctions on our lane but because it was such a vibe it didnt affect us too much. It did make for some laugh. The staff resolved the issue in under 5 min. Its a 10 out of 10 for me. We had a blast.

originalText.text: The location is great, but unfortunately, the manager, a white man named Troy, came across as racist and unprofessional. Upon leaving the bowling alley, I witnessed the manager falsely telling a group of black kids that they were closed, even though the alley had two more hours of operation. Staff members mentioned that the manager's actions were racially motivated, a behavior they claim happens frequently. It's disheartening to see discrimination in such a diverse neighborhood, and due to this experience, I won't be returning to Gutter LES.

originalText.text: I am writing to file a formal complaint regarding the deplorable treatment we received at your establishment. The discriminatory behavior exhibited by your security personnel during our attempt to access the bowling facilities was utterly appalling. Despite having complied with the ID requirement, we were subjected to aggressive and racist behavior. When confronted about this, the security personnel explicitly admitted to discriminatory actions and denied us entry based on racial bias. Even after escalating the issue to the manager, no appropriate resolution was provided. This incident has left us deeply disappointed and we demand a formal apology and immediate corrective action to address this flagrant discrimination.

originalText.text:
The Gutter was an excellent choice for our team outing! We were a group of 20 people and had a blast playing games, enjoying drinks, and indulging in delicious food. We ordered several pizzas, chicken wings, and chicken tenders which were all top-notch in taste and quality.

The atmosphere of The Gutter is lively and interesting, with a great vibe that adds to the excitement of the games. The bartenders were attentive and provided fast service, making sure our drinks were always full and that we were well taken care of.

Overall, The Gutter is a fantastic bowling place that has everything you could want for a fun night out with friends or colleagues. The food, drinks, and service are all exceptional, and the atmosphere is second to none. I highly recommend giving The Gutter a try for your next night out, you won't be disappointed!

originalText.text: The bowling experience was great and all, as you don’t typically see bowling alleys with this sort of layout as it feels like your actually playing in someone’s basement. The only complaint I would like to bring is the pricing and rates, I really wish you were able to bowl a desired number of games instead of having to do so by time. And I also felt kind of ripped off having to pay $35 just to bowl for half an hour, and around $75 if I wanted to bowl for a full hour. All in all, Experience was good, pricing and rates however should see some improvement.
